enum.name: civicAddress
enum.para: The location parameter must contain a comma separated list of IANA codes describing this location.

enum.name: GML
enum.para: The location parameter must contain a comma separated list valid GML elements describing this location.

enum.name: URI
enum.para: The location parameter must contain a single URI parameter which contains an external URI describing this location.

description.para: The contents of this parameter are specific to the specification type.

configOption.name: pidf_element
configOption.synopsis: PIDF-LO element to place this profile in

description.para: Based on RFC5491 (see below) the recommended and default element is device.

configOption.name: received_location_disposition
configOption.synopsis: Determine whether the location information supplied to a channel should be used

configOption.name: send_location
configOption.synopsis: Determine whether the channel will send location information

description.para: For an incoming call leg, this determines if location information will be forwarded to the dialplan. If accept_location is set to yes and location information was actually received from the client, it will be forwarded to the dialplan and any location information in this profile will be ignored. If accept_location is set to no or no location information was received from the client, location information from this profile, if any, will be forwarded to the dialplan. Dialplan functions can modify this information before forwarding to the outgoing call leg.

For an outgoing call leg, this determines if location information will be forwarded to the remote UAS. If accept_location is set to yes and location information was actually received from the dialplan, it will be sent and any location information in this profile will be ignored. If accept_location is set to no or no location information was received from the dialplan, location information from this profile, if any, will be sent.
